description: Numbers n such that, in the binary expansion of n, reading from right to left, the number of 1's never exceeds the number of 0's.
references: H. Niederreiter and M. Vielhaber, Tree complexity and a doubly ..., J. Complexity, 12 (1996), 187-198.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
H. Niederreiter and M. Vielhaber, Tree Complexity and a Doubly Exponential Gap between Structured and Random Sequences, J. Complexity, 12 (1996), 187-198.
mathematica: fQ[n_] := Block[{od = ev = k = 0, id = Reverse@IntegerDigits[n, 2], lmt = Floor@Log[2, n] + 1}, While[k < lmt && od < ev + 1, If[OddQ@id[[k + 1]], od++, ev++ ]; k++ ]; If[k == lmt && od < ev + 1, True, False]]; Select[ Range[0, 204, 2], fQ@# &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 11 2007 *)(* b = A036989 *) b[0] = 1; b[n_?EvenQ] := b[n] = Max[b[n/2]-1, 1]; b[n_] := b[n] = b[(n-1)/2]+1; Select[Range[0, 300, 2], b[#] == 1 &] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Nov 05 2013, after _Reinhard Zumkeller_ *)
prog: (Haskell)a036990 n = a036990_list !! (n-1)a036990_list = filter ((== 1) . a036989) [0..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 31 2013
crossrefs: Each term is 2^n * some term of A014486 (n >= 0).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
